result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric W Cazett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

1.  Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
2.  Defendant is to complete an AODA assessment within 60 days and submit proof to the District Attorney's Office and Clerk of Courts Office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric W Cazett

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from Clerk to Defendant re: Court-ordered Payment Arrangements

1:06 p.m.  Defendant appears in court.
Defendant states he has $100 to pay today.  Can then pay $75 every other week thereafter.  Court authorizes warrant - stay upon payment of $100 today and $75.00 every other week thereafter.
Court adjourned 1:07 p.m.

ADDRESS INFO for Eric W Cazett
Current: 600 S Bridge St, Markesan, WI 53946 United States  (Effective: 12-07-2015)
Prior: 26 N Mill St, Waupun, WI 53963 United States

ADDRESS INFO for Eric W Cazett
Current: 26 N Mill St, Waupun, WI 53963 United States  (Effective: 10-20-2015)
Prior: 809 South Street Apt 101, Green Lake, WI 54941

8:39 a..m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  DA recites agreement - upon plea to the charge, will recommend a fine and costs, DNA Sample & AODA.  Defendant concurs.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-$150 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-AODA Assessment w/in 60 days and proof to the DA & COC office.

Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

Court adjourned at 8:46 a.m.
